page.title: 09TWO EVENTS IN SOUTH REIGATE
page.content: Two annual events occur in the east of the area.An annual fete is held in the Priory Park each summer preceded by a procession of some twen- ty floats.In the park are stalls from Benson's,the local funfair, or spons- ored by various commercial interests. Competitons are held such as the one in which a girl from St.Luke's Middle School won a prize for riding on a bull.Among the floats is one entered by the Sovereign Youth Club. An annual Donkey Derby is held in August on the South Park Football Ground.Spectators are able to become "jockeys" for a day or merely to have a "flutter" on the results of races. Stalls and side-shows are also to be seen.
